name: Cthulhu Realms
description: Star Realms has gone insane! Introducing Cthulhu Realms! Are you zany enough to play the crazier and creepier cousin of Star Realms? Download and play today to find out why Cthulhu Realms is so crazily addictive!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2+ Graphics: DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities; generally everything made since 2004 should work.

reviews.review_text: Very nice deckbuilding game. Fun online and offline. Looking forward to see where this game will head in the future.
Excellent spinoff of Star Realms. Improves on some areas.  My main complaint is the use of icons is messy.

Pretty good and fun deckbuilduing strategy game with the same mechanics as Star Realms but with cartoony-cthulhu theme which put me off a bit at first, but after a while it grew on me. The soundtrack and background sounds are moody and well made. The interface is fine, but could use some double-clicks and things on the cards instead of drag-n-drop or requiring two separate clicks. I played through the free 8 mission campaign which was a good romp and I will be considering getting the full version.
Good Music but the tutorial is as long as cthulu's 3rd tentacle

Now I've got a tale to tell you... of the ones from long ago. There's an evil that's been dreaming, but now it's softly screaming! From the darkness their power will grow. Their voices are made of poison! When you listen you are sure to be disturbed. You can lock your doors, you can say your prayers, no creature can resist their wicked words! Never mind! No need to worry, that's all just a story... of the whispers of the cardstone fiesta.
2/10 didnt even play a single match, coudn't challenge my friend without buying the game might buy it in the future free version is uninstall practice
I have only played a little bit of the game so far, but from what i've seen, it is fun and has a nice art style going for it

I find the game to be more visually appealing than Star Realms, however it isn't quite as deep. I blame this on the small number of cards, and a bit more variety would go a long way into making it better.  I have had no trouble in running the game, and it hasn't crashed on me either, which is a plus.  I do wish I could refund the $5 I spent on unlocking the full version, because it really isn't worth the cash to be honest, but it was my fault in not reading up on what it added.  Still I recommend the game to people that enjoy deck building games, but also to those that like card games in general, and are looking for something new to play. The Free version anyway.  (Still I wouldn't buy the full version until a sale...then again it is only $5 in the end)
Great deck building game that is just painful to play because of lazy port and that's the reason why I can't recommend it to anyone.
